description: On March 17th, 2020, Sao Tome and Principe government announces national state of emergency starting from March 20th.

The San Tomean government declared today the Situation of Public Calamity throughout the country, with effect from 16th of June, revoking the mandatory general confinement that ends because of the Covid-19 that ends 15th of June.
S.Tomé and Príncipe prohibits, as of 3 March, while the epidemic of COVID-19 lasts, the entry to citizens of China, South Korea, Iran, Italy, Nigeria, Egypt and Algeria.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: S.Tomé and Príncipe prohibits, as of 3 March, while the epidemic of COVID-19 lasts, the entry to citizens of China, South Korea, Iran, Italy, Nigeria, Egypt and Algeria. UPDATE: The Sao Tome and Principe government has implemented the third phase of reopening and from 16 July began the reopening of airspace to commercial flights from all countries

description: On March 4th, The Sao Tome and Principe government approved the National Contingency Plan for the Epidemic due to COVID-19 presented by the Ministry of Health, which highlights the measures of surveillance, prevention, containment, hygiene and the involvement of the most varied sectors of national life, taking into account the transversality of matter. It was also decided to create an emergency fund to support the actions of this plan, in the first phase of implementation, in the amount of USD 500,000.00.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared that  Reinforcement of stock of medicines, consumables and reagents to combat COVID - 19 and other diseases that still plague our country. And investing in the process of purchasing fans and other materials necessary to combat COVID-19;

description: The Government of São tome and Principe is creating medical teams to monitor only patients infected with Covid-19, who in turn should also be isolated from their homes, and allocated to spaces created for this purpose.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The San Tomean Government started 7th of May the free distribution of more than 61 thousand masks, mainly to the most vulnerable population, to avoid the contamination of Covid-19 in the country, in an initiative supported by the oil company BP.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Sao Tome and Principe received 12-ton of health resources and health staff from Portugal in partnership with the United Nations and the European Union to fight Covid-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On 9th July, The World Health Organization has just donated to Sao Tome and Principe a batch of 50 oxygen concentrators to fight the Covid-19 pandemic, valued at $34,000.
target_geog_level: An international organization (e.g. World Health Organization)

description: Sao Tome and Principe have since June 22, a new laboratory offered by the World Health Organization (WHO) to perform PCR tests in the country.The laboratory to perform the PCR tests for screening Covid-19 was a piece of long-awaited equipment for the country to have a more rigorous epidemiological picture, as the responsible one points out.
target_geog_level: An international organization (e.g. World Health Organization)

description: On April 6th, 2020 The Sao Tome and Principe government suspended all sea and air connections between the islands of São Tomé and Príncipe, except for health emergency situations duly authorized by the Prime Minister and Head of Government.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: The National Government has adopted new internal borders restrictions, that is mandatory to perform a rapid test when the citizens move from Sao Tome to the Autonomous Region of Principe and vice versa.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative unit within a country (e.g. county)
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: Government of São Tomé decrees mandatory general confinement. The exception are outings for quick purchases and medical emergency situations. The measure does not cover employees in key sectors.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Government of São Tomé decrees mandatory general confinement. The exception are outings for quick purchases and medical emergency situations. The measure does not cover employees in key sectors.
 UPDATE: The national government is implementing Phase 1 of the reopening of economy, that phase includes the revoke of the mandatory lockdown. This phase planned to last from 16 to 30 June.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Covid-19: China donates materials to Sao Tome and Principe to help prevention
type_text: China sent health resources to Sao Tome and Principe to fight coronavirus
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On 06 Apr 2020, The Central Bank of São Tomé and Príncipe (BCSTP) announced the reduction of minimum cash reserves from 18 to 14% in national currency, and from 21% to 17% in foreign currency, due to the crisis caused by covid-19.
type_text: Monetary policy determinated by the central bank of the government
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On July 23th, African Development Fund gives $10 million to Sao Tome and Principe to mitigate the impact of COVID- 19, with the overall objective of protecting lives and livelihoods. The package of policy measures agreed with Government include strengthening health systems to cope with the surge in hospitalisations and scaling up testing and tracing systems; expanding social protection systems to cushion its most vulnerable populations; and to provide cash relief to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises(SMEs).
target_geog_level: An international organization (e.g. World Health Organization)

description: On April 6th 2020, The government of Sao Tome and Principe declared that all restaurants, bars, cafes, pastry shops and mobile homes must closse, with the exception of those with home delivery services.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is closed/locked down

description: The Fardo Market was closed and the vendors will be allowed to sell their products on the front of their houses.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within a country

description: On March 5th, 2020 Sao Tome and Principe prohibits official travel by state officials to countries with a high incidence of the Covid-19 virus.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared the prohibition of meetings, gatherings and meetings with more than 10 people.
Funerals and wakes will not be held with more than 20 persons.
type_sub_cat: Cancellation of an annually recurring event

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared obligation to respect the sanitary distance of 2 meters, use of masks by employees and provision of washbasins or alcohol for the disinfestation of customers and users, in all institutions, public or private, that provide services to the public.
On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared Immediate activation of the isolation center complementary to the Central Hospital.
The government is enforcing for all citizens on public roads and all providers of services to the public to wear protective masks.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
